suggestions.title: Mangoes
suggestions.subtitle: Summer fruit (Dec–Mar)
suggestions.description: Limpopo produces ~75% of South Africa’s mangoes, harvested mid‑December to late March.

suggestions.title: Avocados
suggestions.subtitle: Subtropical fruit
suggestions.description: Around 60% of South Africa’s avocados come from Limpopo’s subtropical regions like Tzaneen.

suggestions.title: Citrus (Oranges, Grapefruit)
suggestions.subtitle: Citrus fruit
suggestions.description: Major citrus producer, with large volumes from Letsitele/Tzaneen; citrus season runs February–October.

suggestions.title: Tomatoes
suggestions.subtitle: Versatile vegetable
suggestions.description: Limpopo supplies ~60% of South African tomatoes, with strong production in Polokwane and Tzaneen.

suggestions.title: Bell Peppers & Other Vegetables
suggestions.subtitle: Year‑round veggies
suggestions.description: Bell peppers, cabbage, spinach, squash, chilies, onions, green beans, cucumbers are widely grown.

suggestions.title: Macadamia & Pecans
suggestions.subtitle: High‑value nut trees
suggestions.description: Well-suited to Limpopo’s climate; increasingly planted for their economic potential.

suggestions.title: Blueberries, Raspberries
suggestions.subtitle: Temperate berries
suggestions.description: Grown in cool escarpment areas near Haenertsburg/Tzaneen, with harvests from November to March.

suggestions.title: Aloe vera (Aloe ferox)
suggestions.subtitle: Medicinal succulent
suggestions.description: Thrives in Limpopo’s dry, hot conditions; used in cosmetics and traditional medicine.

suggestions.title: Morogo (African spinach)
suggestions.subtitle: Leafy green
suggestions.description: Nutritious traditional leafy vegetable, rich in vitamins A and C, protein up to 36%.
